MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
THIS REPORT CONTAINS SEXUALLY EXPICIT INFORMATION
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001386
Special Investigation Intake Date: May 1, 2024
License #: CB810201161

Agency Name: Hands Across the Water
Agency Address: 781 Avis Dr Ste 200
Suite 200
Ann Arbor, MI 48108-8959
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 08/10/2025

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
Description suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that an agency worker sexually assaulted a bio-
mother on the agency's caseload.
Investigation The agency Chief Administrator was notified of the complaint
and interviewed on 05/02/24. The Chief Administrator was
notified of the complaint. The Chief Administrator reported Staff 1,
the alleged perpetrator in this case, has been the foster care
worker for the Bio-Mother and her children for the past two years
and has had a good working relationship and rapport with Bio-
Mother. The Chief Administrator reported there have not been any
disciplinary issues with Staff 1 and he is a good foster care
worker. Chief Administrator reported that since the allegation,
which was made in Court on April 30th, 2024, Staff 1 has been
removed from the case. Chief Administrator added the agency
had recommended removal of the children from the care of the
Bio-Mother during the Court Hearing on April 30, 2024.
The Bio-Mother was interviewed via telephone on 05/13/24.
Bio-Mother reported Staff 1 had asked her for sexual favors, and
she could keep her children if she complied. Bio-Mother reported
specifically, Staff 1 asked her to perform oral sex on him. Bio-
Mother also reported Staff 1 had touched her buttocks. These
alleged incidents took place in her home while Staff 1 was
conducting a home visit on April 12, 2024. Bio-Mother reported
there were no witnesses who heard the statements made by Staff
1 or observed the reported touching. Bio-Mother reported she
called the Inkster Police Department on April 26, 2024, and
reported the incidents. Bio-Mother reported on April 30th or May 1,
2024, her children were removed from her care.
2

Staff 1 was interviewed via video conference on 05/20/24.
Staff 1’s attorney was also present. Staff 1 reported he has been
the foster care worker for Bio-Mother and her children since
November 2022. Staff 1 reported he never had any problems in
working with Bio-Mother and he had found her cooperative. Staff 1
denied he had ever made any sexual comments towards Bio-
Mother as well as denying that he touched her buttocks or asked
her for oral sex. Staff 1 reported the allegations made by Bio-
Mother occurred on April 30, 2024, during a court hearing in which
the agency recommended removal of Bio-Mother’s children from
her care. Staff 1 was asked and denied that he had ever received
any disciplinary action while employed with the agency.
Bio-Mother was interviewed a second time via telephone on
05/20/24. Bio- Mother reiterated Staff 1 had asked her to “give him
head” and if she did not, she would not be able to keep her
children. Bio-Mother denied she had performed oral sex on him.
Bio-Mother reported she did not think he would follow through in
recommending removal of her children even if she did not perform
oral sex on him.
Staff 1 was interviewed a second time via video conference
on 05/24/24. Staff 1 reported the agency Foster Care Supervisor
attended the April 30th, 2024, court hearing and made the
recommendation the children of Bio-Mother be removed from her
care. Staff 1 reported he was not in court that day. Staff 1 reported
he had been removed from the case several days earlier, but he
was unsure of the exact date he was removed from the case. Staff
1 reported he was removed to protect him from further allegations.
Staff 1 reiterated he did not touch or make any sexual advances
towards Bio-Mother. Staff 1 reported that his April 12, 2024, visit
was a routine visit to the Bio-Mothers home with no reports of
concern occurring during this visit. Staff 1 was informed that Bio-
Mother made an additional allegation during a May 21, 2024,
Family Team Meeting (FTM) that he had raped her. Staff 1
reported he had not raped Bio-Mother or touched her in any way.
Chief Administrator reported Staff 1 was removed from further
work and interaction on the case on 5/01/24.
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on
05/24/24. The Foster Care Supervisor is the supervisor for the
agency foster care program. The Foster Care Supervisor reported
Bio-Mother would likely have known about the agency’s
recommendation for removal of her children before the April 30,
3

2024, court hearing via her attorney. The Foster Care Supervisor
could not verify this however or as to what date the Bio-Mother
would have had knowledge of the removal recommendation.
Foster Care Supervisor reported she was at the hearing and
recommended removal of the children.
Foster Care Supervisor reported she supervises Staff 1 and he
had never received any disciplinary action while employed with
the agency. Foster Care Supervisor reported Staff 1 had never
made any sexual comments or told jokes of a sexual nature with
herself or fellow employees.
Foster Care Supervisor reported she was in attendance at the
May 21, 2024, FTM and heard Bio-Mother report she was raped
by Staff 1. Foster Care Supervisor reported Bio-Mother did not
report the rape was a verbal rape. Foster Care Supervisor
reported the FTM was terminated after the allegation of rape was
made.
Police Officer 1 was contacted via telephone on 05/30/24. I
requested a copy of the police report generated from Bio-Mothers
contact with the police department. Police Officer 1 emailed me
the report on this date.
Bio-Mother was interviewed a third time via telephone on
05/30/24. The Bio-Mother was asked about the rape allegation
she had made during the May 21, 2024, FTM. Bio-Mother stated,
“I said he was a rapist, not that he raped me”. Bio-Mother denied
she was physically raped but there is verbal rape and Staff 1’s
comments meant rape. When asked why she had delayed in
making the rape allegation she reiterated that it was verbal rape.
The Bio-Mother defined verbal rape as sexual comments such as
Staff 1 asking her for oral sex.
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed a second time via
telephone on 06/03/24. Foster Care Supervisor reported Bio-
Mother had said, during the May 21, 2024, FTM, that she was
raped by Staff 1. Foster Care Supervisor reported Bio-mother at
that time did not say it was verbal rape, only that she had been
raped.
Staff 2, an agency foster care worker assigned to the case,
was interviewed via telephone on 06/04/24. Staff 2 reported she
is now the foster care worker for Bio-Mother and her children
since Staff 1 was removed from the case. Staff 2 reported she
was present at the May 21, 2024, FTM and she heard Bio-Mother
4

state she was raped by Staff 1. Staff 2 reported she did not hear
any qualifying statement from Bio-Mother that it was a verbal rape.
Staff 2 reported the FTM was cancelled after the allegation of rape
and because the Bio-Mother was using profanity, and she was
escalated.
Detective 1 was briefly interviewed on 06/04/24 via telephone.
Detective 1 reported he was going to conduct interviews of Staff 1
and Bio-Mother on 06/05/24 or 06/06/24 and he would contact me
after the interviews and determine if an investigative case would
be opened.
Detective 2 was interviewed on 06/07/24. Detective 2 reported
he had been assigned to do initial interviews with Bio-Mother and
Staff 2. Detective 2 reported he would contact me if the
department was to initiate a formal investigation. To date, no
contact has been received notifying they opened an investigation
On 07/02/24 a voice mail message was left for Detective 2
requesting a return phone call. As of the date of this report a
return call has not been received.
On 7/11/2024 an email was sent to the Inkster law enforcement
department requesting assistance in gathering a case update. As
of the date of this report, a response has not been received.
On 8/02/2024 an email was sent to Inkster law enforcement
department requesting updated records. As of the date of this
report, a response has not been received.
On 10/28/2024 a meeting was held with Chief Administrator and
Area Manager. A discussion was held pertaining to the
investigation. Chief Administrator indicated Staff 1 has yet to be
interviewed by law enforcement officials.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
• Case File: An FTM dated 05/21/24 indicates the FTM was
terminated due to inappropriate language. Staff 2 reported
that the Bio-Mother was using profanity and was escalated.
It was also during this FTM that the Bio-Mother reported
that she was raped by Staff 1.The file did not add anything
else to the investigation.
• On 5/30/2024, an emailed request for the law enforcement
report was made and received the same day. Inkster Police
Department case report number 240007976, dated
04/26/24, was reviewed. The report speaks to the
5

complaint made by Bio-Mother which documents that the
Bio-Mother was asked to perform oral sex on Staff 1 and
that he grabbed her buttocks. The report further documents
that the Bio-Mother reported that Staff 1 had told her that if
she does not perform oral sex on him her children would be
removed from her care.
Analysis Bio-Mother initially reported she had been touched on her buttock
by Staff 1 and Staff 1 told her he would not recommend removal of
her children if she performed oral sex on him. Bio-Mother reported
the touching by Staff 1 and Staff 1 asking for oral sex occurred on
04/12/24. On 4/26/2024 Bio-Mother reported to Inkster Police
Department that Staff 1 asked her to perform oral sex and had
grabbed her buttock. Then, during a court hearing on 4/30/24 Bio-
Mother stated Staff 1 asked her to perform oral sex. During an
FTM on 5/21/24, Bio-Mother had stated she had been raped by
Staff 1. In a third interview with Bio-Mother she stated she was
verbally raped by Staff 1. Bio-Mother reported there were no
witnesses to these comments and actions.
Staff 1 denied he ever touched Bio-Mother or had used sexually
explicit language or comments or had asked her for oral sex.
Evidence is inconclusive as the Bio-Mother and Staff 1’s reports
contradict one another. There were no witnesses to the alleged
events. The Inkster Police Department stated they would notify if a
formal investigation was opened, and no contact was received
back indicating they had done so.
If additional information is received, further investigation may be
required.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
September 23, 2024
______________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
